Amazon made $10.8 billion in profits, didn't pay a dime in federal taxes, and got a $129 million check from the IRS—courtesy of Mitch McConnell and the Republican Senate.

But as our people suffer, a $2,000 check to the working class is "socialism for the rich"? Give me a break. https://t.co/lpj2sD9Aev
I am once again asking for a yes-or-no vote on $2,000 survival checks. https://t.co/chyjmMgspS

Not long ago, people said a $15 minimum wage was unthinkable. But a grassroots movement refused to take no for an answer.

Today, the President's order begins raising the minimum wage to $15/hour for federal contractors.

Now, Congress must pass a $15 living wage for ALL workers.

Minimum wage in Australia: $19.84 an hour
Unemployment rate in Australia: 6.6%

U.S. federal minimum wage: $7.25 an hour
U.S. unemployment rate: 6.7%

Please don't tell me raising the minimum wage to a living wage - at least $15 an hour - costs jobs.

Minimum wage in 1968 (in today's dollars): $11.84

Federal minimum wage in 2021: $7.25

Please do not tell me that in the richest country on Earth, we cannot guarantee a living wage of at least $15 an hour to every worker in America.

As initial author of #GreenNewDeal in US in 2010, I had a far faster timeline (2030) to move to 100% clean energy. @POTUS fails to call for halt to fossil fuels. Need an Economic Bill of Rights - #Medicare4All. guaranteed living wage jobs. And major cuts in military spending,.

3/ Tragically, the very severe weather has resulted in loss of life today. My thoughts and condolences are with those affected.

2/ Unfortunately as #Malik subsides, Storm #Corrie is about to hit from late tomorrow afternoon & may be more severe for parts of Scotland - eg Highlands, Grampian, Tayside than anticipated. Please follow @metoffice for any updates to the weather warnings in place.
4/ My thanks to everyone across the country who is working hard and in difficult conditions to repair the impact of the severe weather and support those affected by it.

About to join ABC TV @BreakfastNews to talk about how we can keep power bills down while reining in the greed of the coal and gas corporations.

With a windfall tax, we can freeze electricity bills, and help households & businesses have money to get off expensive and dirty gas.

The message to Proud Boys & Nazis that spent their time threatening a family-friendly Pride event for young people yesterday is loud & clear:

You’ll always lose in Melbourne.

After a decade of Liberal attacks on workers' pay and conditions, we’ve finally passed something that tips the scale back.

The IR Bill is the first step in a long journey to restore and improve the rights of workers in this country.

Here's the gas lobby last night horrified that parliament would "interfere in the market".

"Market" in this case = price gouging an essential service, climate wrecking drilling, banking obscene profits & often not paying any tax.

It's the beginning of the end for gas grifters.

Under Labor, the number of new coal, oil and gas projects is going up.

With 118 coal, oil and gas projects now in the pipeline, the number of climate destroying projects is increasing under this government.

@DavidShoebridge @larissawaters @helenhainesindi @AlboMP It's disappointing that Labor and Liberal joined forces to block politicians having to face public hearings, give the government of the day a huge amount of power in selecting the Commissioner, and narrow the definition of corruption.

The fight has to go on.
We should be reining in the coal and gas corporations’ mega-profits with a windfall tax to help households and businesses not just with rising energy bills, but to get off gas completely.

I'm devastated to hear of the passing of Professor Will Steffen.

A fearless and devoted giant of climate activism, who was endlessly generous with his time and expertise.

Vale and thank you, Will.

Like many of you, I've been watching videos and photos of unprecedented floods around our country and Aotearoa NZ.

I've been reading the warnings of El Nino fires again next summer.

Sometimes it feels hopeless. But it's not.

Coal and gas is fuelling these climate crises.
@DavidShoebridge @larissawaters @helenhainesindi @AlboMP With a NACC now established, we've got a force that we can strengthen until we get the strongest model we can.

Safeguarding the climate means no new coal and gas.

But Labor's plan keeps every one of Morrison’s new coal & gas projects.

It's greenwashing - plain and simple.

It’s the International Day of Solidarity with the Palestinian People.

We reaffirm our & the UN’s calls to end the Occupation and end the human rights abuses.

It’s time for justice for Palestinians.

The next few years will be exciting, and maybe a bit scary.

My advice? Don't give up your passion, your drive for a better world, or your anger at a system built to favour the rich.

At the end of it, I hope it's not you that's changed, but the system.

We're all counting on it.

We’ve got a NACC! After more than decade of pushing for an anti-corruption watchdog, it’s passed the Senate with two Greens amendments. 

Now, the big work to clean up the corruption of the last government begins.

A temporary price cap on gas won’t make electricity bills affordable.

The only lasting solution is to help households and businesses get off gas by electrifying with renewables, funded by a windfall tax on the greedy coal and gas corporations.

When we talk about systemic racism - this is it.

Racism killed Veronica. More than 500 First Nations people have been killed in custody since 1991.

We must implement every recommendation from the Royal Commission into Aboriginal Deaths in Custody.

#JusticeForVeronicaNelson

With the NACC bill passing with Greens amendments, we finally have an anti-corruption watchdog with some teeth.

A good day for democracy. A terrible day for corrupt politicians.

If allowed to go ahead these 118 coal, oil & gas projects will be a climate disaster, blow Labor’s weak targets & drive extreme weather.

Climate action means no new coal & gas.

We need a climate trigger in our environment laws & safeguard reforms that curb new coal & gas.

The NACC has to be independent.

No government, Liberal or Labor, should have the sole power to choose the people tasked with holding them to account.

The Environment Minister said Australia will lobby against an ‘in danger’ listing for the Great Barrier Reef as ‘we’ve dealt with’ major concerns.

There are 114 new coal & gas mines in the pipeline across the country.

Let’s be clear Labor - that’s the major concern.

Congrats to everyone who's finished your VCE today - it's a bloody big day.

Now you've got an even bigger challenge ahead of you: you're going to be the generation to shake this country up for the better.

It's a lot to put on your shoulders, I know.
@Greens The Greens will not support a single dollar going to coal corporations. The coal and gas corporations should be compensating the people, not the other way around.

There's no time to waste, and Labor's greenwashing won't cut it.

The Greens are ready to negotiate in good faith.

But we must hold the line with fossil fuel corporations.

No new coal and gas.
